snippet: Arab diplomats in France have been criticized for quietly withdrawing the prize money for a literary award to Boualem Sansal, a famous Algerian novelist, because he visited Israel.
abstract: Arab diplomats in France have been sharply criticized for quietly withdrawing the prize money for a literary award because the winner, Algerian novelist Boualem Sansal, visited Israel; many French denounce the decision as an unacceptable incursion of politics into art; diplomats from Arab League nations who are under fire, have said little, except that they are following the policies of their countries, which remain in a formal state of war with Israel.
lead_paragraph: Arab diplomats in France have been criticized for quietly withdrawing the prize money for a literary award to Boualem Sansal, a famous Algerian novelist, because he visited Israel.

headline.main: Arab Envoys Rebuked for Denying Prize Money to Algerian Writer
headline.print_headline: Arab Envoys Rebuked for Denying Prize Money to Algerian Writer
